benchmark_details.name: MVTamperBench
benchmark_details.overview: MVTamperBench is a benchmark that systematically evaluates MLLM robustness against five prevalent tampering techniques: rotation, masking, substitution, repetition, and dropping; based on real-world visual tampering scenarios. It comprises 3.4K original videos, expanded into over 17K tampered clips covering 19 distinct video manipulation tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically evaluate the robustness of MLLMs against video tampering techniques.

data.source: 3.4K original videos from MVBench, augmented to create tampered clips through systematic manipulation.

methodology.calculation: F1 Score is calculated based on the model's performance on video manipulation detection.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 Scores indicate better model robustness against tampering.
